Text: O LORD, my heart is not proud, nor my eyes haughty. I do not concern myself with matters too great or too wondrous for me.
Context: The psalmist expresses humility before God, acknowledging his own limitations and choosing not to be overwhelmed by matters beyond his comprehension.

Text: But I have calmed and quieted my soul, like a weaned child with its mother; my soul is like a weaned child within me.

Text: O Israel, put your hope in the LORD, both now and forevermore.
Context: The psalm concludes with an exhortation to the people encouraging them to trust in the enduring faithfulness of God.
